content.text:
The data for evaluating the validity of a screening test can be compiled into the following table format.<image 1>The specificity is

A. A/(A+C)
B. B/(B+D)
C. C/(A+C)
D. D/(B+D)

To determine the specificity of a screening test, we need to look at the table and identify the relevant values. Specificity is defined as the proportion of true negatives ( (B/(B+D) in the table.

Specificity = B/(B+D)

So, the correct answer is:

B. B/(B+D)
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
